body_html: Perhaps we can be more careful about when we call format_stack? We do this lazily to avoid the cost of formatting, but is there a way to check that the graph in the stack still exists?
body_text: Perhaps we can be more careful about when we call format_stack?  We do this lazily to avoid the cost of formatting, but is there a way to check that the graph in the stack still exists?
body: Perhaps we can be more careful about when we call [format_stack](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/b05573e268d9bedfb6f7bbc20aea570f1800ec64/tensorflow/python/util/tf_should_use.py#L60)?  We do this lazily to avoid the cost of formatting, but is there a way to check that the graph in the stack still exists?
